tweets.text: Westlands is full of landfill gas again, starting to smell it in the house again so likely in for another night of health effects & no sleep. Shame on you @EnvAgency and your duplicity in this outrage on our health. Shame on you @PHE_EoEngland for not protecting our health

@SianieRoo @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency @PHE_EoEngland Same here awful, still not recovered from last night's exposure, headaches still& breathing issues, stinging eyes, resorted to taping upfront door, can't get out, stink still sleeping in, desperate measures not working #stopthestink

@save_our_fields I am terribly sorry. Thank you for doing your best. This Government is just against the preservation of wildlife - this is their disgrace and that of the local council. Shame on you @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA @pow_rebecca @MPGeorgeEustice @AvantHomes

tweets.text: Hi @EnvAgencyNW Re Carlisle Flood Risk Management Scheme Phase 2. The footpaths in Carlisle near Eden Bridge are still closed? They were due to be open at the start of March & then start of April. But still all fenced off? What‚Äôs the new date for getting the paths back please? Ta

tweets.text: @SOPH_C_ I could smell it Saturday morning Seabridge Lane area Clayton.

No wonder the River Wye is in trouble. 345 raw sewage discharges last year in Ross alone, totalling nearly 2 months of sewer overflow directly into the river. 
#EndSewagePollution #TogetherForRivers 
https://t.co/nUma74d5qx https://t.co/scLI0vO0yZ

urls.title: Raw Sewage in our Rivers - The Rivers Trust
urls.description: Sewage is discharged into rivers across the UK and Ireland on a daily basis. This isn‚Äôt an isolated problem; it occurs up and down the country, affecting urban city centre rivers and pristine chalk streams alike. At The Rivers Trust, we believe that people should be able to swim, paddle, catch and play without worrying [‚Ä¶]
